bug.author: opencv-pushbot
bug.summary: OpenCV Manager package not found for Samsung Galaxy Edge
bug.description:
Transferred from <denchmark-link:http://code.opencv.org/issues/4162>http://code.opencv.org/issues/4162</denchmark-link>
<denchmark-code>|| Jonas Bark on 2015-01-30 13:28 || Priority: Normal || Affected: 2.4.9 (latest release) || Category: android || Tracker: Bug || Difficulty: || PR: || Platform: Any / Android </denchmark-code>
<denchmark-h:h2>OpenCV Manager package not found for Samsung Galaxy Edge</denchmark-h>
<denchmark-code>Our customers report that, although installed, the OpenCV Manager package cannot be found from our app. There's also a german review of the OpenCV Manager App in the Play Store saying the same thing:
https://play.google.com/store/apps/details?id=org.opencv.engine&hl=de
I'm afraid I can't provide more information as we do not own a Galaxy Note Edge. </denchmark-code>
<denchmark-h:h2>History</denchmark-h>
